Ingrediants Required - 
• Cornflours - 4 tablespoons 
• Maida flour - 2 tablespoons 
• White button mushroom - 250 grams 
• Garlic paste - ½ teaspoon 
• Ginger paste - ½ teaspoon 
• Soy sauce - ½ teaspoon 
• Oil (for frying) - as required 
• Salt - as required 
• Water - 4 tablespoons
 
INGREDIENTS FOR SAUTÉING - 
• Garlic paste - ½ teaspoon 
• Ginger paste - ½ teaspoon 
• Green chilly (finely chopped) - 1 
• Onion (finely chopped) - 1 
• Spring onions (finely chopped) - 2 tablespoons 
• Oil - 2 tablespoons 
• Soy sauce - 1 ½ tablespoons 
• Chilly sauce - ½ tablespoon 
• Tomato ketchup - 2 tablespoons 
• Salt - as required
 
METHOD - 
1. Wash and clean mushrooms to remove any dirt. Dry them with kitchen towel and cut them into medium pieces. 
2. Mix maida flour, cornflour, ginger paste, garlic paste, ½ teaspoon soy sauce, salt and 4 tablespoons water in a bowl. 
3. Mix and make a medium thick batter. Dip mushrooms pieces in prepared batter and coat them with it. 
4. Heat oil in a deep frying pan (pan). Deep fry them over medium flame until they just started to turn light golden brown. 
5. Do not deep fry them long time otherwise they start to release the water and oil may be splatter. 
6. Take them out from oil and drain excess oil.
 
METHOD TO SAUTÉ - 
1. Heat 2 tablespoons oil in a wide, thin-bottomed, pan (wok) on high flame. 
2. Add ginger paste, garlic paste, chopped green chilly and diced onion. 
3. Sauté on high flame for 1-2 minutes. 
4. Add soy sauce, tomato ketchup,chilly sauce, salt,fried mushroom pieces and spring onion; mix them well. 
5. Now toss and cook. Keep tossing everything and cook for 1-2 minutes. 
6. Delicious dry mushroom manchurian is ready.
